New Records: India became the first team to fail to defend 200-plus totals in T20Is at home more than once in a calendar year
India are also only the second team after South Africa in 2016 among full members of the ICC to end up on losing side despite posting 200 or more on the board
Key Match Events: Australia chased down 209 against India to take a 1-0 series lead in Mohali
Cameron Green took the limelight in the first half of the innings and later it was Wade's match-winning innings that helped Australia get over the line
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma praised the batters for posting a 200-plus score while adding that the bowlers were not up to the mark and the fielding did not help as well
Rohit further praised Hardik for his super 71-run knock while adding that Indian team management will need to look at the bowling woes before the second T20I
Miscellaneous Highlights: India registered their highest ever score against Australia in the T20I
Bhuvneshwar Kumar conceded 52 runs, while Harshal leaked 49
Others: Rohit said in the post-match presentation ceremony that 200 is a good score to defend, and they didn't take their chances on the field
